Description: Iron arrow-head with triangular (?) section and tang. Now very corroded and broken in a conical shape, though may have been barbed originally.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

These iron arrowheads were found by Petrie in 1886, one of which was found at his level 320, which he dated 6th century BC (Petrie 1886, 39, pl.XI.2, 3, 4). however this seems likely to have been contamination as tanged and barbed trilobate arrow-head are commonly dated to the Roman period (Snodgrass 1967). Snodgrass, A. M. 1967, Arms and armour of the Greeks, London.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (SB.78) (Phase 2)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 39, pl. XI.4)
